src_text: Go tsenngwa tirisong ga manaane a botlhokwa a puso Kabinete e amogela diphitlhelelo tse di tlhagisitsweng ke Moporesitente Jacob Zuma ka nako ya ketelo ya setsha kwa Boemelakepeng jwa Port Elizabeth kwa Kapa Botlhaba, go sekaseka kgatelopele e e leng teng malebana le go tsenngwa tirisong ga Operation Phakisa: e leng maiteko a Ikonomi ya Mawatl Puso e golotse dipeeletso tse di ka nnang bokana ka R17 bilione mo Ikonoming ya Mawatl Fa e sale e tlhomiwa, go tlhamilwe ditiro di feta 4 500 mo maphateng a a farologanenMekoro e e gogang e le mebedi mo go e e robongwe e e agiwang ke Southern African Shipyards ba e agela Bothati Jwa Boset haba jwa Maemelakepe jwa Transnet (TNPA) kwa Boemelakepeng jwa Durban di lebile kwa Boemelakepeng jwa Port Elizabet Moporesitente Zuma o tlhomile mokoro wa ntlha o o gogang kwa Port Elizabeth, o o teilweng leina la Mvezo, o teelelwa lefelo le Moporesitente Nelson Mandela a belegetsweng kwa go lonTNPA e abile madi a feta R7 bilione go tokafatsa maemelakepe a ron Moporesitente o ne a lebelela mafelo a dikepe di emelang mo go ona a a nt hwafaditsweng mo Boemelakepeng jwa Port Elizabeth a a tla kgonang go amogela dikepe tse dingwe di le 12 fa a bapisiwa le a ga jaana a a amogelang di le ped Kabinete e leboga baduelalekgetho botlhe ba ba tshwaraganeng le puso mo ngwageng wa dit helete wa 2015/16 go tsholetsa kokoanyo ya rona ya lotseno go ya go R1 trilione la ntlh Seno ke sesupo se se tlhamaletseng se se ka ga maatla a ikonomi ya rona e e tsweletseng pele le fa go le thata jaanKe fela ka tuelo ya lekgetho ya maAforika Borwa a a obamelang melao mmogo le kokoanya e e matlhagatlhaga ya letseno ka Tirelo ya Lekgetho ya Aforika Borwa (SARS) moo puso e kgonang go tlamela ka botlalo ditirelo tse di tlhokegang tse di nang le seabe mo tokafatsong ya matshelo a maAforika Borw Kabinete e amogela kitsiso ya ga Moporesitente Zuma ya gore la bo 3 Phatwe 2016 ke letlha la Ditlhopho tsa Pusoselegae tsa 2016.
trg_text: Implementation of key government programmes Cabinet welcomes the achievements highlighted by President Jacob Zuma during his site visit to the Port of Port Elizabeth in the Eastern Cape, to assess progress made on the implementation of the Operation Phakisa: Oceans Economy initiativ Government has unlocked investments amounting to about R17 billion in the Oceans Econom Since its inception, over 4 500 jobs have been created in various sectorTwo of the nine tugboats being built by the Southern African Shipyards for Transnet National Ports Authority (TNPA) in the Port of Durban are destined for the Port of Port Elizabet President Zuma launched the first tugboat in Port Elizabeth, named the Mvezo, after the birthplace of former President Nelson MandelThe TNPA has allocated over R7 billion to improve our port The President viewed the refurbished and reconstructed slipway and lead-in jetties within the Port of Port Elizabeth that will be able to accommodate 12 more vessels as compared to the current tw Cabinet thanks all taxpayers who have partnered with government in the 2015/16 financial year to take our revenue collection to R1 trillion for the first tim This is a clear demonstration of the strength of our thriving economy even under difficult circumstanceIt is through the tax contributions of compliant South Africans and the effective collection by the South African Revenue Service that government is better able to provide much-needed services that contribute to improving the lives of South African Cabinet welcomes President Zuma s announcement of 3 August 2016 as the date for the 2016 Local Government Election Government is pleased that the two registration weekends on 5

src_text: Puso e kgotsofaditswe ke gore mafelo a beke a mabedi a ikwadiso a la bo 5-6 Mopitlwe le la bo 9-10 Moranang a ne a na le palo e e kwa godimo ya ba ba ka tlhophang ba ba neng ba etetse ditei ene tsa ditlhopho, bogolo segolo ba ba tla bong ba tlhopha la ntlha mmogo le ba wKabinete e leboga botlhe ba ba tsibogetseng boikuelo jwa go ikwadisa le go tlhola dintlha tsa bona mo lenaneng la batlhop Ke fela ka seabe sa rona mmogo re ka bonang temokerasi ya rona e golKabinete e ikuela mo baaging botlhe ba ba iseng ba ikwadise gongwe go tlhola dintlha tsa bona go etela dikantoro tsa Khomi ene e e Ikemetseng ya Ditlhopho kwa makgotlatoropong a bona le go nt hwafatsa dintlha tsa bona mo lenaneng la batlhophi (ba tlamele ka diaterese) le go ikwadisetsa go tlhopha ka ditlhopho tsa la bo 3 Phatw Gape batlhophi ba ka romela dinomoroitshupo tsa bona ka SMS mo go 32810 gongwe go letsetsa tikwatikwe ya kgolagano kwa 0800 11 8000 go tlhomamisa seemo sa bonIkwadiso e netefatsa gore leina la gago le teng mo lenaneng la batlhophi gore o kgone go tlhoph Kabinete e ikuela mo baaging botlhe go diragatsa tshwanelo ya bona ya temokerasi e e lwetsweng ka thata ya go tlhopha mo Ditlhophong tsa Dipusoselegae tsa 2016 ka la bo 3 Phatwe 2014.
trg_text: Local Government is everyone s business .Cabinet calls on all South Africans and sectors to demonstrate their patriotism by participating in the various events commemorating Freedom Mont During the upcoming weeks, Parliament will be holding departmental Budget Vote The respective departmental Executives will unpack their operational plans for the 2016/17 financial yea Members of the public will be informed about service-delivery programmes of government Cabinet s position on key issues in the environment Cabinet welcomed the response and subsequent apology by President Zuma to the Constitutional Court judgment relating to compliance with remedial actions set out in a report of the Public ProtectoCabinet is studying the judgment to establish if there are any other actions to be undertaken to strengthen the role of the Public ServicThe Constitutional Court judgment reinforces and asserts South Africa s constitutional democrac Cabinet noted the actions by the four banks that gave notice to close the bank account of a compan Whilst Cabinet appreciate the terms and conditions of the banks, the acts may deter future potential investors who may want to do business in South Afric Cabinet has endorsed that the Ministers of Finance, Labour and Mineral Resources should open a constructive engagement with the banks to find a lasting solution to this matte Cabinet congratulated the Minister of Health, Dr Aaron Motsoaledi, who received the USAID-TB international award in recognition of his leadership in the global fight against tuberculosis (TB) as well as championing South Africa's and regional initiatives in the screening, treatment and prevention of TB; TB/HIV co-infection and multi-drug resistant T Cabinet welcomes the nomination of South Africa as the 2016 recipient of the Distinguished Diplomatic Service Award by the World Affairs Council in Washington, D As the first African country to receive this award, it recognises the country s outstanding commitment to global education, international affairs and global communications to advance our national interestCabinet commends the Minister of International Relations and Cooperation, Ms Maite Nkoana-Mashabane, for her contribution to South Africa s international engagements, which are driven by the vision of a

src_text: Kabinete e amogela go tlhomiwa semmuso ga Porojeke ya Tekeletso ya eChannel ya Lefapha la Merero ya Selegae (DHA) ke Moporesitente Zum Thulaganyo eno e nt hwa ya boitlhamedi e letla baagi go dira dikopo tsa dikarata tsa boitshupo mo inthaneteng go tila mela e meleelTirisanommogo eno le dibanka tse dikgolo di le nne - Dibanka tsa ABSA, FNB, Nedbank le Standard - go tsenyatirisog serala sa go dira dikopo ka inthanete tsa dikarata tsa boitshupo le makwalo a mosepele go kgontsha badirisi go etela dikioseke tsa Lefapha la Merero ya Selegae go isa fela dikgatiso tsa menwana le ditshwantsho morago ga go dira peelano le tuelo mo inthaneteneChannel ke karolo ya togamaano ya tlhabololo ka kakaretso ya lefapha go tlosa ditirelo kwa mokgweng wa pampiri go ya go wa dijitale, e leng tsamaiso e e tla akaretsang go phepafatsa rejisetara ya baag Kabinete e amogela katlego ya Beke ya Imbizo e e neng e tshwerwe fa gautshwane ka moono wa 'Mmogo re tswetsa pele Aforika Borwa', e mo go yona batlhankedi ba puso ba neng ba kopana le baagi go ralala nagKabinete e akgola maAforika Borwa a a nnileng le seabe mo manaaneng a feta 36 go ralala naga, a a netefaditseng gore puso e tsibogela ditlhokego tsa baagi tse di supilwen Beke ya Imbizo e maatlafaditse baagi ka tshedimosetso e e ka ga manaane a pus Lefapha la Manno a Batho le ne le amogetse khonferese e e atlegileng tota ya Dit habakopano (UN) e e dirang ka mafelo a baipei, e gatelela seelo se se kwa godimo sa phudugelo mo metsesetoropong mmogo le go gola ga mafelo a baipe Ga jaana batho ba le bilione mo lefatsheng ba nna mo mafelong a baipe Fa e sale ka 1994, Aforika Borwa e agile matlo a le dimilione e le karolo ya go netefatsa gore go nna le botshelo jo bo botoka go botlhe MelaotlhomoKabinete e amogetse Melaotlhomo e e latelang: Molaotlhomo wa Tshireletso ya Dikago tsa Botlhokwa wa 2016 o o tla phasaladiwang mo Kaseteng ya Puso gore baagi ba tshwaele mo go onMolaotlhomo o phimola Molao wa Dintlha tsa Botlhokwa tsa Boset haba, wa 1980 (Molao wa bo 102 wa 1980), mme o ikaelela go lepalepanya thulaganyo ya go supa le go goeletsa dikago tsa botlhokwa ka tsela e e seng bofitlha mme e le maikarabel Gape o tla netefatsa gore dikago tsotlhe tsa botlhokwa tsa tshireletsego ya set haba mo nageng di a supiwa mme di sirelediwa ka tsela e e malebMolaotlhomo o dira tlamelo ya gore go tlhomiwe letlhomeso la setheo go tlhokomela le go tsamaisa tshireletso ya dikago tsotlhe tsa botlhokw Gape o tlhalosa tiro ya bothati jo bo tla gakololang Tona ya Sepodisi ka kgoeletso ya dikago tsa botlhokw Molaotlhomo o o Baakantsweng wa Mekgatlho ya Dithoto tse di Tlhakanetsweng wa 2016 o o tla phasaladiwang gore baagi ba tshwaele mo go on Molaotlhomo ono o baakanya Molao wa ga jaanong wa Mekgatlho ya Dithoto tse di Tlhakanetsweng, wa 1996 (Molao wa bo 28 wa 1996).Molaotlhomo o tla maatlafatsa thulaganyo ya bolaodi jwa temokerasi jwa Mekgatlho e e leng teng ga jaana ya Dithoto tse di Tlhakanetsweng gongwe ditheo tsa Dikgwama tse di okameng mafatshe a a tlhakanetsweng ke baag Molaotlhomo ono o o baakantsweng o dira tlamelo ya gore go tlhomiwe Mokwadisi mo Lefapheng la Tlhabololo ya Metseselegae le Nt hwafatso ya Naga, mme o tlhalosa tiro ya kantoro en Fa Molaotlhomo o setse o fetisitswe jaaka molao, o tla maatlafatsa taolo ya ditheo tsa bolaodi le go tokafatsa tshegetso ya Mmuso mo go tsonO tla kgontsha baagi go bona, go tshola le go tsamaisa dithoto ka ditheo tsa tsamaiso tse di bokgoni tse di tshegediwang ke pus Go itsisewe ga Molaotlhomo wa Bodit habat haba wa Tsereganyo wa 2016 kwa Palamenten Thulaganyo ya tsereganyo ya bodit habat haba ke sediriswa sa botlhokwa sa go gweba go ralala melelwane ya nag E tla tokafatsa phitlhelesego ya ditirelo tsa bosiamisi mo ditlamong tse di gwebang kwa ntle ga naga le ditlamo tsa kwa ntle tse di mo Aforika Borw Molaotlhomo o phimola Molao wa Temogo le Tiragatso ya Dikabo tsa Tsereganyo ya Dinaga di sele, wa 1977 (Molao wa bo 4 wa 1977) mme gape o baakanya Molao wa ga jaana wa Tshireletso ya Kgwebo, wa 1978 (Molao wa bo 99 wa 1978).
trg_text: Together we move South Africa forward , which saw government officials interacting with communities throughout the countrCabinet commends those South Africans who participated in over 36 programmes across the country, which ensured that government responded to identified community need The Imbizo Focus Week has empowered communities with information on government programme The Department of Human Settlements hosted a very successful United Nations (UN) conference dealing with informal settlements, emphasising the phenomenal rate of urbanisation and the growth of slum Now one billion people in the world live in slum South Africa has since 1994 built millions of houses as part of ensuring a better life for all BillsCabinet approved the following draft Bills: Critical Infrastructure Protection Bill of 2016 to be published in the Government Gazette for public commenThe Bill repeals the National Key Points Act, 1980 (Act 102 of 1980), and seeks to align the process of identifying and declaring critical infrastructures in a transparent and accountable manne It will also further ensure that all critical infrastructures for the national security of the country are identified and adequately protecteThe Bill provides for the setting up of an institutional framework to monitor and administer the protection of the critical infrastructure It further defines the functions of the body that will advise the Minister of Police in the declaration of critical infrastructure The Communal Property Associations Amendment Bill of 2016 to be published for public commen The Bill amends the current Communal Property Associations Act, 1996 (Act 28 of 1996).The Bill will strengthen the democratic governance process of the existing Communal Property Associations or existing Trust entities that oversee communal lan The amended Bill provides for the setting up of the Registrar in the Department of Rural Development and Land Reform, and defines the functions of this offic Once this Bill is passed into law, it will strengthen the regulation of governance institutions and enhance State support to theIt will enable communities to acquire, hold and manage properties through effective statutorily established administration entities supported by governmen The introduction of the International Arbitration Bill of 2016 to Parliamen The international arbitration process is an essential tool for doing business across the borders of the countr It will improve access to justice services for companies doing business outside the country and foreign companies in South Afric The Bill repeals the Recognition and Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards Act, 1977 (Act 40 of 1977) and also amends the current Protection of Business Act, 1978 (Act 99 of 1978).

src_text: Molaotlhomo o o tshitshinngwang o lepalepana le Sekao sa Molao wa Tsereganyo ya Kgwebo ya Bodit habat haba, se se amogetsweng ke Khomi ene ya UN ya Molao wa Kgwebisano ya Bodit habat hab Go phasaladiwa ga Molaotlhomo o o Baakantsweng wa Setheo sa boset haba sa Dipatlisiso wa 2016 mo Kaseteng ya Puso gore batho ba tshwaele mo go on Molaotlhomo o baakanya Molao wa Setheo sa Boset haba sa Dipatlisiso, wa 1998 (Molao wa bo 23 wa 1998).Molaotlhomo o tla tokafatsa bokgoni jwa Aforika Borwa jwa go gaisana mo tlhabololong ya dipatlisiso le boitlhamedi ka tsamaiso ya kgolagano le set haba ka tsela e e bokgoni, e e lekaneng mme e gokagane ya saense, mmogo le tlamelo le phitlhelesego e e tokafetseng ya ditlamelo tsa dipatlisis Gape o tla tokafatsa tsibogo le bokgoni jwa tlhabololo ya dipatlisiso le tlamelo ya boitlhamedi, go tokafatsa boleng jwa botshelo jwa maAforika Borwa ka go lepalepanya ditlapele tsa puso botoka Ditshwetso tse di botlhokwa tsa Kabinete Kabinete e amogetse lekwalotlhomo la mabudusatsela la Sepodis Lekwalotlhomo la mabudusatsela le phasaladitswe la ntlha gore baagi ba tshwaele mo go lona ka Mopitlwe 2015.
trg_text: The proposed Bill aligns with the Model Law on International Commercial Arbitration, which has been adopted by the UN Commission on International Trade La The publication of the draft National Research Foundation Amendment Bill of 2016 in the Government Gazette for public commen The Bill amends the National Research Foundation Act, 1998 (Act 23 of 1998).The Bill will improve South Africa s competitiveness in research development and innovation through effective, adequate and coordinated management of public engagement with science, and improved research infrastructure provision and acces It will also improve the responsiveness and effectiveness of research development and innovation provision, to improve the quality of life of South Africans through better alignment with government priorities Key Cabinet decisions Cabinet adopted the White Paper on Policin The draft White Paper was first published for public comment in March 2015.

src_text: Lekwalo le dira tlamelo ya tirelo ya sepodisi e e ikamanyang le boagi jo bo tlhaga mme e tsibogela tikologo ya ga jaana ya sepodis Gape le dira tlamelo ya Tirelo ya Sepodisi sa Aforika Borwa le sepodisi sa metro se se maikarabelo e bile se le porofe enal Gape Lekwalotlhomo la mabudusatsela le ikuela gore go tlhamiwe Boto ya Boset haba ya Sepodisi e, gareng ga tse dingwe, e tla rwalang maikarabelo a go tlhoma ditlhokego tsa go ngoka badiri, go tlhopha le go thapa bangokiwa ba bant hwa mo tirelong ya sepodis Kabinete e amogetse Lekwalotlhomo la mabudusatsela la Tshireletsego le Pabaleseg Lekwalotlhomo la Mabudusatsela le le setseng le ntsheditswe go batla maikutlo a batho ka Tlhakole 2015, le totile mokgwa o o lotaneng wa tlhabololo wa pabalesego e e sa feleleng fela mo sepodisin Le ikaelela go kaela mo dikgatong tse di tla thusang baagi ka thibelo mo mererong ya tshireletseg Lekwalotlhomo la Mabudusatsela le supa mafapha otlhe a a maleba mmogo le mekgatlho ya baagi e e tshwaelang mo pabalesegong ya baag Kabinete e rebotse Pholisitlhomo ya Tiragatso ya Setso ya Thupiso mo Aforika Borwa mme e rebotse gore Lefapha la Merero ya setso le simolole go kwala molao wa boset haba wa thupis Pholisi e setse e fetile mo thulaganyong ya patlomaikutlo a baamegi ba ba malebPholisi e tlamela ka kaedi e e netefatsang tshireletso ya meetlo ya setso ya thupiso ya basimane ya ngwaga le ngwaga kwa ntle ga go ba baya mo kotsin Seno ke karolo ya dikgato tse puso e di tsayang go maatlafatsa meetlo e e maleba e bile e amogeleseg E busetsa seelo se se amogelesegang sa maikarabelo go botlhe ba ba tsamaisang dikolo tsa thupiso le batsadi ba ba romelang bana kwa dikolong tsen Kabinete e amogetse dikatlegeniso tse di dirilweng ke Komiti ya Dipatlisiso malebana le kgonagalo ya go gweba ka manaka a ditshukudu jaaka boitlhophelo jwa go ka somarela ditshukudu tsa nag Dikatlenegiso di tshegeditswe ke Komiti ya Setegeniki ya Bogakolodi ya Mafapha le Komiti ya Ditona e e thapetsweng go batlisisa kgonagalo ya go dira gore go nne le kgwebisano ya semolao ya bodit habat haba ya manaka a tshukudDikatlenegiso di tshegetsa mokgwa wa tsamaiso ya togamaano ya Aforika Borwa wa go rarabolola mathata a bogodu jwa ditshukudu mmogo le kgwebisano e e seng mo molaong ka ditshukud Komiti e atlenegisa gore mokgwa wa ga jaana wa go tshola seelo sa naga o tswelediwe go na le gore go gwebisanwe ka manaka a ditshukud Togamaano ya naga e akaretsa tshireletso; maatlafatso ya baagi;
trg_text: The paper provides for a police service that is biased towards active citizenry and responds to the existing policing environmen It also provides for a South African Police Service and metro police that is accountable and professiona The White Paper also calls for the establishment of a National Police Board which, amongst other tasks, will be responsible for setting up the objective criteria for the recruitment, selection and appointment of new recruits in the police service Cabinet adopted the White Paper on Safety and Securit The White Paper, which has already been out for public consultation in February 2015, focuses on an integrated and developmental approach to safety beyond policin It seeks to guide on preventative safety measures for communitie The White Paper identifies all the relevant departments and community-based organisations that contribute to the safety of communitie

src_text: Dolosse .Dithadiso tsa madi, mmogo le dikgoeletso tsa tsona, di tla gatisiwa mo Kaseteng ya Puso, mme di tla tlhagisiwa le go rekisiwa ka ditsela tsa setlwaedi Ditiragalo tse di tlang Magareng ga la bo 18 le la bo 22 Moranang 2016, Moporesitente Zuma o tla tsaya maeto a tiro kwa mebusong e e leng ditokololo tsa Mokgatlhotshwaraganelo wa Ditso tsa Borwa jwa Aforika (SACU) e e akaretsang wa Namibia, Botswana, Lesotho le wa Swazilan Maeto a tla tokafatsa seabe sa botlhokwa se SACU e nang naso go tsweletsa kgolagano ya kgaolo le tlhabololo ya ikonomi ya ditokololo tsotlhe tsa yon Moporesitente o tla tsaya Leeto la Semmuso go ya kwa Rephaboliking ya Islamo ya Iran ka la bo 23 le la bo 24 Moranang 2016 go maatlafatsa dipuisano tsa sepolotiki le tsa ikonomi magareng ga dinaga ka bobed Moporesitente o tla etelela pele meletlo ya Boset haba ya Letsatsi la Kgololesego ka la bo 27 Moranang 2016 kwa Limpopo, kwa Lebaleng la Metshameko la Giyani ka moono wa:
trg_text: Dolosse .The coin designs, together with their proclamations, will be printed in the Government Gazette, and will then be manufactured and sold through the normal channels Upcoming events President Zuma will between the 18 and 22 April 2016 undertake working visits to member states of the Southern Africa Custom Union (SACU) which include Namibia, Botswana, Lesotho and Swazilan The visits will enhance the important role that SACU plays in promoting regional integration and economic development of all its member The President will undertake a State Visit to the Islamic Republic of Iran on 23 and 24 April 2016 to strengthen political and economic engagements between the two countrie The President will lead the National Freedom Day celebrations on 27 April 2016 in Limpopo, Giyani Stadium under the theme:

src_text: "Mmogo re aga baagi ba ba botoka - Pusoselegae e ama mongwe le mongwe".Kabinete e ikuela mo maAforika Borweng otlhe le maphata otlhe go bontsha boikanyego jwa bona ka go nna le seabe mo ditiragalong tse di farologaneng tsa segopotso sa Kgwedi ya Kgololeseg Mo dibekeng tse di tlang, Palamente e tla tshwara Ditekanyetsokabo tsa mafaph Bakhuduthamaga ba ba farologaneng ba mafapha ba tla ala maano a bona a tiro a ngwaga wa dit helete wa 2016/17.

src_text: Baagi ba tla itsisewe ka manaane a tlamelo ya ditirelo a puso Maemo a Kabinete mo Mererong e e Botlhokwa ya ga jaana Kabinete e amogetse tsibogo le kopo ya boitshwarelo ya ga Moporesitente Zuma malebana le katlholo ya Kgotlatshekelo ya Molaotheo malebana le go obamela dikgato tsa paakanyo tse di tlhagelelang mo pegelong ya Mosireletsi wa Set habKabinete e buisa katlholo go bona gore a go na le dikgato dingwe gape tse di tshwanetseng go tsewa go maatlafatsa seabe sa Tirelo ya Set habKatlholo ya Kgotlatshekelo ya Molaotheo e tlhomamisa temokerasi ya Aforika Borwa ya molaothe Kabinete e lemogile dikgato tse di tserweng ke dibanka di le nne tse di ntshitseng kitsiso ya go tswala akhaonto ya banka ya setlam Le fa Kabinete e amogela melawana le dipeelo tsa dibanka, dikgato tseo di ka tshosa babeeletsi ba isago ba ba ka batlang go dira kgwebo mo Aforika Borw Kabinete e tlhomamisitse gore Ditona tsa Dit helete, Bodiri le Ditlamelo tsa Diminerale di tshwanetse go bula dipuisano tse di agang le dibanka go bona tharabololo ya leruri ya morero on Kabinete e akgotse Tona ya Boitekanelo, Ngaka Aaron Motsoaledi, yo o amogetseng sekgele sa bodit habat haba sa USAID-TB ka ntlha ya boeteledipele jwa gagwe mo ntweng ya lefatshe kgatlhanong le bolwetsi jwa lehuba (TB) gammogo le go etelela pele maiteko a Aforika Borwa le a kgaoloa go tlhatlhoba, go alafa le go thibela TB; tshwaetso ya TB/HIV mmogo le TB e e dipelang melem Kabinete e amogela go supiwa ga Aforika Borwa jaaka moamogedi wa 2016 wa Sekgele sa Tirelo e e Kgethegileng ya Sedipolomate (Distinguisned Diplomatic Service Award) ke Lekgotla la Merero ya Lefatshe kwa Washington D Jaaka naga ya ntlha ya Aforika go amogela sekgele seno, se lemoga maitlamo a naga a thuto ya lefatshe, merero ya bodit habat haba mmogo le tlhaeletsano ya lefatshe go tsweletsa dikgatlhego tsa set habKabinete e akgola Tona ya Dikamano tsa Bodit habat haba le Tirisanommogo, Mme Maite Nkoana-Mashabane, ka ntlha ya tshwaelo ya gagwe mo dipuisanong tsa Aforika Borwa tsa bodit habat haba, tse di tsamaisiwang ke ponelopele ya "kontinente ya Aforika e e kopaneng mme e na le kagiso, temokerasi, e sa tlhaole go ya ka bosemorafe, e sa tlhaole go ya ka bong mme e humile, le e e tshwaelang mo lefatsheng le le nang le tshiamo le tekatekan" Kabinete e amogela go thapiwa ke Moporesitente Zuma ga Moatefokate Jan Lekhoa Mothibi jaaka Tlhogo ya Yuniti ya Dipatlisiso tse di Kgethegileng, mme e rata go mo eletsa masego mo maikarabelong a gagwe a mant hwa a go lwantsha bobodu le tsamaiso e e sokamen Kabinete e romela matshediso a a tswang kwa botennye jwa dipelo kwa lelapeng la ga Makwetu le Pan Africanist Congress ka go tlhokafala ga Rre Clarence Makwet Rre Makwetu o tla gakologelwa ka ntlha ya tshwaelo ya gagwe e e boitshegang le go intsha setlhabelo mo mokgatlhong o o neng o lwela kgololesego mmogo le go tlhamiwa ga Aforika Borwa e nt hwa ya temokeras Moporesitente o goeleditse gore phitlho ya mogaka ono wa kgaratlho ya kgololesego e nne Phitlho e e Kgethegileng ya Semmuso ya Porofens Kabinete e romela matshediso a a tswang kwa botennye jwa dipelo kwa lelapeng la ga Naidoo ka go tlhokafala ga Rre Kumarana Naido Rre Naidoo e ne e le Mokaedikakaretso wa Namaotshwere wa Lefapha la Tlhabololo ya Ikonom O kile a dira jaaka Motlhankedimogolo wa Dit helete wa Lefapha la Kgwebisano le Indaseter Rre Naidoo o tshwaetse go utlwala mo tsamaisong ya dit helete mo Tirelong ya Set hab Kabinete e tlhagisitse malebo ka tshwaelo e e dirilweng ke Rre William Smith, yo o dirileng jaaka Mokwaledi wa Kabinet Rre Smith o rotse tiro ka bogodi kwa bokhutlong jwa Mopitlwe morago ga go direla Tirelo Set haba dingwaga di le 27.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomes the appointment by President Zuma of Advocate Jan Lekhoa Mothibi, as the Head of the Special Investigating Unit, and wishes him all the best in his new responsibilities of combating corruption and maladministratio Cabinet conveys its heartfelt condolences to the Makwetu family and the Pan Africanist Congress on the passing of Mr Clarence Makwet Mr Makwetu will be remembered for his immense contribution and personal sacrifices to the liberation movement and the establishment of the new democratic South Afric The President declared a Special Provincial Official Funeral for the liberation struggle stalwar Cabinet conveys its heartfelt condolences to the Naidoo family on the passing of Mr Kumaran Naido Mr Naidoo was the Acting Director-General of the Department of Economic Developmen He previously served as the Chief Financial Officer of the Department of Trade and Industr Mr Naidoo has contributed immensely in financial management within the Public Servic Cabinet expressed its appreciation on the contribution made by Mr William Smith, who served as Cabinet Secretaria Mr Smith retired at the end of March after serving the Public Service for 27 year Cabinet wishes him well on his retirement The Cabinet was briefed about the Report of the Commission of Inquiry into Allegations of Fraud, Corruption, Impropriety or Irregularity in the Strategic Defence Procurement Package (Arms Procurement Commission) which was released by the President this morninThe Report has found no evidence of wrongdoing, bribery, fraud or corruption in the arms procurement process, As Government we welcome the findings of the Commissio We have been vindicated as we have stated over many years that there was no wrongdoing and that the procurement had been above boarWe trust that the findings will bring closure to this long drawn out matteWe join President Zuma in thanking Justice Willie Seriti and Judge Thekiso Musi, all the witnesses, including former President Thabo Mbeki, evidence leaders, legal teams, staff and those who contributed to making the work of the Commission a success AppointmentsAll appointments are subject to the verification of qualifications and the relevant clearanc Mr Siyabonga Gama as Group Executive and Mr Garry Pita as Group Chief Financial Officer of Transne Mr Lufuno

src_text: Kabinete e mo eletsa molemo mo pakeng ya gagwe ya phen ene Kabinete e lotlegetswe ka ga Pegelo ya Khomi ene ya Dipatlisiso malebana le Magatwe a Tsietso, Bobodu, Tsamaiso e e sa siamang mo Thulaganyong ya Theko ya tsa Phemelo (Khomi ene ya Theko ya Dibetsa) e e golotsweng ke Moporesitente mosong onPegelo e fitlhetse go sena bosupi jwa molato, pipamolomo, tsietso gongwe bobodu mo thulaganyong ya theko ya dibets Jaaka Puso re amogela diphitlhelelo tsa Khomi en Re tlhatswitswe maina jaaka re sa bolo go bua mo dingwageng tse dintsintsi gore ga gona phoso epe le gore theko e dirilwe ka tshwanelRe solofela gore diphitlhelelo di tla tswalela morero ono o o sa bolong go rerwRe golagana le Moporesitente Zuma go leboga Moatlhodi Willie Seriti le Moatlhodi Thekiso Musi, dipaki tsotlhe, go akarediwa le Moporesitente wa maloba Thabo Mbeki, batsamaisi ba bosupi, ditlhopha tsa molao, badiri le botlhe ba ba tshwaetseng go atlegisa tiro ya Khomi ene Go thapiwaGo thapiwa gotlhe go tla diragadiwa fa makwalothuto otlhe a netefaditswe mme go amogetswe tetlelelo e e matshwanedi:
trg_text: Cabinet approved the draft Policy on the Customary Practice of Initiation in South Africa and approved for the Department of Traditional Affairs to commence drafting national legislation on initiatio The policy has already gone through an extensive public consultation process with relevant stakeholderThe policy provides guidelines that ensure the protection of the traditional custom of the annual initiation of young boys without compromising their safet This forms part of the steps that government is taking to reinforce appropriate and acceptable custom It restores an acceptable level of accountability to those that run initiation schools and parents that send their children to these school Cabinet approved the recommendations made by the Committee of Inquiry on the feasibility of trading in rhino horns as one of the options to preserve the country s rhino populatio The recommendations were endorsed by the Interdepartmental Technical Advisory Committee and the Inter-Ministerial Committee appointed to investigate the possibility of legalising commercial international trade in rhino horThe recommendations endorse South Africa s integrated strategic management approach to resolving the poaching of rhino and illegal trade in rhin The committee recommends that the current mode of keeping the country s stock levels be kept as opposed to the trading in rhino horn The country s strategic approach entails security; community empowerment; biological management; responsive legislative provisions that are effectively implemented and enforced; and demand managemen Cabinet approved the following 2016 commemorative coin designs:a) The National Geographic Coin Series
